segments.en: Hello, everyone.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you, again, our romantic, dramatic suspense series, I'm Sorry, I Love You, Part 7.
segments.cn: 今天我们再次为您带来我们的浪漫戏剧悬疑系列《对不起，我爱你》第7部分。

segments.en: So we're going to find out what's happening with Steven and Veronica.
segments.cn: 所以我们要看看Steven和Veronica发生了什么。

segments.en: Right, in the last episode, Veronica was at the doctor's, she was pregnant.
segments.cn: 对，在上一集，Veronica在看医生，她怀孕了。

segments.en: But then the doctor told her it was a lie, and he made it up, and she wasn't even pregnant.
segments.cn: 但医生告诉她那是谎言，他编造的，她根本没有怀孕。

segments.en: Exactly.
So now let's see what Veronica and Steven are going to say to each other.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看Veronica和Steven会对彼此说什么。

segments.en: Maybe they will break up?
I don't know.
I don't think so.
But let's listen.
Thank God you showed up when you did.
He's insane.
Do you think we should call the police?
segments.cn: 你觉得我们应该报警吗？

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
I'll call my friend and have him take care of it.
segments.cn: 我会打电话给我的朋友，让他来处理。

segments.en: I can't believe he was stalking you all these years.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他这些年一直在跟踪你。

segments.en: What a nutjob.
I know.
Well, he said I'm not pregnant.
I'm sorry if I got you all worked up over nothing.
segments.cn: 如果我让你为此紧张，我很抱歉。

segments.en: I want you to know that I didn't do it on purpose.
segments.cn: 我想让你知道我不是故意的。

segments.en: Don't apologize.
From the moment I met you, not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you.
segments.cn: 从我见到你的那一刻起，没有一天我没有想过你。

segments.en: And now that I'm with you again, I'm just I'm just scared, Veronica.
segments.cn: 现在我又和你在一起，我只是，我只是害怕，Veronica。

segments.en: The closer I get to you, the worse it gets.
segments.cn: 我越接近你，情况就越糟。

segments.en: The thought of not being with you.
I mean, I just can't handle it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我真的无法承受。

segments.en: We were made for each other, Veronica.
segments.cn: 我们是天造地设的一对，Veronica。

segments.en: You're my everything.
My soulmate.
What can I do?
Just hold me.
I'll always be here for you no matter what.
segments.cn: 无论发生什么，我都会一直在你身边。

segments.en: And together, we can tackle whatever life throws at us.
segments.cn: 我们可以一起应对生活中的一切挑战。

segments.en: I believe in us, Steven.
I'm so happy to hear that.
I know we belong together.
segments.cn: 我知道我们是天生一对。

segments.en: I love you so much.
Oh, it was such a romantic moment.
segments.cn: 哦，那是如此浪漫的时刻。

segments.en: And now what happened?
Somebody got shot.
Oh, my God, I don't know.
This is like so big.
I can't believe this is happening.
segments.cn: 我无法相信这正在发生。

segments.en: Well, it's a very intense drama.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一部非常紧张的戏剧。

segments.en: But we saw some great words and a lot of great phrases in there when Steven was telling her all these beautiful words, right?
segments.cn: 但我们看到了一些很棒的词汇和很多美丽的短语，当Steven对她说这些美丽的话时，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So why don't we look at some of these words now in Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来看看这些词汇在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language Takeaway Veronica was glad or wish she was very happy that Steven showed up.
segments.cn: 语言收获，Veronica很高兴，或者说她非常高兴Steven出现了。

segments.en: That's right.
Showed up.
So to show up.
Right.
To come to a place.
Okay.
Or to arrive.
That's right.
So let's listen to some examples of how we can use show up in different contexts.
segments.cn: 那么让我们听听一些如何在不同语境中使用“出现”的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
We were waiting for you like an hour and you never showed up.
segments.cn: 我们等了你一个小时，你却从未出现。

segments.en: Example two.
I didn't invite him to the party.
segments.cn: 我没有邀请他参加派对。

segments.en: He just simply showed up uninvited.
segments.cn: 他只是未经邀请就出现了。

segments.en: Example three.
After months of being lost, my dog finally showed up with a family.
segments.cn: 经过几个月的迷路，我的狗终于和一个家庭一起出现了。

segments.en: All right, so I think it's pretty clear now the verb show up.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我想现在动词“出现”很清楚了。

segments.en: And I think this verb is a little bit informal, isn't it?
segments.cn: 我认为这个动词有点非正式，不是吗？

segments.en: Yes, you wouldn't really tell your boss, hey, I'm waiting for you to show up.
segments.cn: 是的，你不会真的告诉你的老板，嘿，我在等你出现。

segments.en: It's a bit too informal.
As you know, the doctor, he was stalking Veronica.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，医生一直在跟踪Veronica。

segments.en: That's right.
So that's our next word.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: Stock.
To stalk somebody.
S -T-A-L-K.
Okay.
Stock.
Now, this isn't a good thing, right?
No, this is bad.
So what happens when you stalk someone?
segments.cn: 那么当你跟踪某人时会发生什么？

segments.en: You follow them secretly for a long time.
segments.cn: 你秘密地跟随他们很长时间。

segments.en: And then maybe you watch them and...
You're standing outside their window watching them get undressed or something.
segments.cn: 你站在他们窗外看他们脱衣服或其他什么。

segments.en: Okay, so many famous people have stalkers, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，许多名人都有跟踪者，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, which is the noun.
The noun form, exactly.
So if I am stalking somebody, I am considered to be a stalker.
segments.cn: 所以如果我在跟踪某人，我就被认为是一个跟踪者。

segments.en: Yes, so to stalk.
So don't do this.
So Stephen described this stalker as a nut job.
segments.cn: 所以Stephen把这个跟踪者形容为疯子。

segments.en: A nut job.
Nut job.
A nut job.
Okay, very, very informal and it doesn't really mean anything literally, but it's crazy.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常非常非正式，实际上并没有什么字面意思，但它是疯狂的。

segments.en: Yes, it means a crazy person.
segments.cn: 是的，它意味着一个疯狂的人。

segments.en: A crazy person.
What a nut job.
He's a nut job.
Okay, so would you really call this to someone, like, to their face?
segments.cn: 好吧，你真的会当面对某人这样说吗？

segments.en: No, no, definitely not.
It's definitely impolite.
Right, you can't say to someone, oh, you're a nut job.
segments.cn: 对，你不能对某人说，哦，你是个疯子。

segments.en: Yeah, but it's not a swear word.
No, but it's a little bit insulting, right?
That's right.
It's like saying you're crazy, but stronger.
segments.cn: 就像说你疯了，但更强烈。

segments.en: Well, the doctor was a nut job, he was stalking her, and she apologized to Stephen for getting him worked up.
segments.cn: 嗯，那个医生是个疯子，他在跟踪她，她为让斯蒂芬激动而道歉。

segments.en: Worked up.
So work up.
To be worked up.
When you get worked up, what happens?
segments.cn: 当你激动时，会发生什么？

segments.en: You get really emotional and usually angry or sad or upset, but a negative emotion.
segments.cn: 你会变得非常情绪化，通常是生气、伤心或不安，但都是负面情绪。

segments.en: Okay, so you got worked up.
So it's always used with the verb to get, so to get worked up.
segments.cn: 所以它总是与动词“变得”一起使用，所以变得激动。

segments.en: Okay, you get worked up.
You got worked up.
Okay, very good.
And well, Stephen got worked up over nothing, but he didn't mind.
segments.cn: 而且，斯蒂芬对无事激动，但他并不介意。

segments.en: He said she is his love, and he called her his soulmate.
segments.cn: 他说她是他的爱，他称她为他的灵魂伴侣。

segments.en: His soulmate.
Soulmate.
That's right, a very romantic word, meaning the perfect person for you.
segments.cn: 没错，非常浪漫的词，意味着你完美的人。

segments.en: Right, your other half.
Yes.
Okay, so your soulmate is that perfect compliment for you.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你的灵魂伴侣是那个完美的补充。

segments.en: And it's usually romantic, right?
segments.cn: 而且通常是浪漫的，对吧？

segments.en: Usually romantic, but sometimes you might use it with your very, very, very best friend.
segments.cn: 通常是浪漫的，但有时你可能会用它来形容你非常非常好的朋友。

segments.en: Because you understand each other.
Yeah, you know what the other one's thinking.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道对方在想什么。

segments.en: You're the perfect fit together.
Okay, soulmate.
Very good.
Well, we've seen some really interesting words, so why don't we listen to our dialogue again, and then we'll come back and look at some of the phrases that were used.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们看到了一些非常有趣的词，所以我们再听一遍对话，然后再回来看看使用的一些短语。

segments.en: Thank God you showed up when you did.
He's insane.
Do you think we should call the police?
segments.cn: 你认为我们应该报警吗？

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
I'll call my friend and have him take care of it.
segments.cn: 我会打电话给我的朋友，让他来处理。

segments.en: I can't believe he was stalking you all these years.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他这些年一直在跟踪你。

segments.en: What a nut job.
I know.
Well, he said I'm not pregnant.
I'm sorry if I got you all worked up over nothing.
segments.cn: 如果我让你无缘无故激动，我很抱歉。

segments.en: I want you to know that I didn't do it on purpose.
segments.cn: 我想让你知道我不是故意的。

segments.en: Don't apologize.
From the moment I met you, not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you.
segments.cn: 从我见到你的那一刻起，没有一天我没有想过你。

segments.en: And now that I'm with you again, I'm just, I'm just scared, Veronica.
segments.cn: 现在我又和你在一起，我只是，我只是害怕，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: The closer I get to you, the worse it gets.
segments.cn: 我越接近你，情况就越糟。

segments.en: The thought of not being with you.
I mean, I just can't handle it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我真的无法承受。

segments.en: We were made for each other, Veronica.
segments.cn: 我们是天造地设的一对，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: You're my everything.
My soulmate.
What can I do?
Just hold me.
I'll always be here for you, no matter what.
segments.cn: 无论如何，我会一直在你身边。

segments.en: And together, we can tackle whatever life throws at us.
segments.cn: 我们可以一起应对生活中的一切。

segments.en: I believe in us, Steven.
I'm so happy to hear that.
I know we belong together.
segments.cn: 我知道我们是天生一对。

segments.en: I love you so much.
That was a little bit more clear this time.
But now I want to look at some phrases in the dialogue and see how they can be put together.
segments.cn: 但现在我想看看对话中的一些短语，看看它们如何组合在一起。

segments.en: Putting it together.
So Veronica apologized to Steven for getting him worked up over nothing.
segments.cn: 所以维罗妮卡为让斯蒂芬无缘无故激动而道歉。

segments.en: Over nothing.
Over nothing.
Now it's the complete sentence.
I'm sorry for getting you worked up over nothing.
segments.cn: 我为让你无缘无故激动而感到抱歉。

segments.en: So over nothing means for no reason, right?
segments.cn: 所以无缘无故意味着没有理由，对吧？

segments.en: Right, exactly.
So why don't we listen to some other examples of how we can use over nothing?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不听听其他一些如何使用无缘无故的例子呢？

segments.en: Example one.
You always get angry over nothing.
You have such a bad temper.
Example two.
I called the police last night over nothing.
I thought I had a thief in my house.
Example three.
Let's not fight over nothing.
Let's just have dinner and peace.
segments.cn: 我们就吃晚餐，享受平静吧。

segments.en: Okay, so we see you can use many different verbs together with over nothing.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们看到你可以与无缘无故搭配许多不同的动词。

segments.en: So get excited over nothing.
Get angry over nothing.
Get upset over nothing.
Exactly.
Very good.
So over nothing.
And now for our next phrase.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的下一个短语。

segments.en: So when Steven was telling Veronica how much he loved her, he told her not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you.
segments.cn: 所以当斯蒂芬告诉维罗妮卡他有多爱她时，他告诉她没有一天过去我没有想过你。

segments.en: So not a day has gone by.
So that part of the sentence, not a day has gone by, what does he mean by that?
segments.cn: 句子的那部分，没有一天过去，他是什么意思？

segments.en: He means basically every day I think of you.
segments.cn: 他基本上是说我每天都在想你。

segments.en: There hasn't been a moment where I haven't thought of you.
segments.cn: 没有一刻我没有想过你。

segments.en: Now, how can we change it a little bit?
segments.cn: 现在，我们怎么能稍微改变一下呢？

segments.en: What can we change within this phrase?
segments.cn: 我们可以在这个短语中改变什么？

segments.en: Well, you can put in different times.
segments.cn: 嗯，你可以放入不同的时间。

segments.en: Okay.
So not a day has gone by.
Not an hour has gone by.
Not a moment has gone by.
Not a month, not a year.
Exactly.
Okay.
So you can use different times in that phrase.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在那个短语中使用不同的时间。

segments.en: But an important thing is that the compliment is always negative, right?
segments.cn: 但一个重要的事情是，赞美总是带有否定，对吗？

segments.en: That's right.
So it's always followed by a negative.
segments.cn: 所以它总是跟着一个否定。

segments.en: Not a day has gone by that I haven't wished you were here.
segments.cn: 没有一天过去我没有希望你在这里。

segments.en: Okay.
So it's followed by a negative.
That's right.
Maybe one more.
Not a second has gone by that I haven't missed you.
segments.cn: 没有一秒过去我没有想念你。

segments.en: Okay.
Very good examples.
Very romantic.
Oh, Marco.
All right.
And now our last phrase.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: He told her, I'll always be here for you no matter what.
segments.cn: 他告诉她，无论如何我都会在你身边。

segments.en: No matter what.
No matter what.
So no matter what.
What does he mean by that?
Well, regardless of or, you know, nothing's going to stop me.
segments.cn: 嗯，无论如何，或者，你知道，没有什么能阻止我。

segments.en: Okay.
So if I want to get that job, I'm going to get it no matter what.
segments.cn: 所以如果我想得到那份工作，我会无论如何得到它。

segments.en: So nothing's going to stop you.
segments.cn: 所以没有什么能阻止你。

segments.en: Now we can change the WH word what at the end, right?
segments.cn: 现在我们可以改变最后的WH词“什么”，对吗？

segments.en: Other ones.
So no matter where, no matter where you are, I will find you.
segments.cn: 所以无论在哪里，无论你在哪里，我都会找到你。

segments.en: Yeah.
No matter when, no matter when your birthday is, I will be there.
segments.cn: 无论何时，无论你的生日是什么时候，我都会在那儿。

segments.en: That's right.
You can see how you can use different WH words here.
segments.cn: 你可以看到你可以在这里使用不同的WH词。

segments.en: Okay.
Very good.
And it's a very common phrase, right?
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的短语，对吗？

segments.en: No matter what, no matter where, no matter when, no matter why, no matter how.
segments.cn: 无论如何，无论在哪里，无论何时，无论为什么，无论如何。

segments.en: No matter how.
Okay.
So those were some really great phrases and I think you can play with them a little bit, change some things, and then you can use them in your everyday life.
segments.cn: 所以这些都是一些非常好的短语，我认为你可以稍微玩一下，改变一些东西，然后在日常生活中使用它们。

segments.en: That's right.
But why don't we hear them again one more time in context with the dialogue.
segments.cn: 但我们为什么不再在对话中听一遍呢？

segments.en: Thank God you showed up when you did.
He's insane.
Do you think we should call the police?
segments.cn: 你认为我们应该报警吗？

segments.en: Don't worry about it.
I'll call my friend and have him take care of it.
segments.cn: 我会打电话给我的朋友，让他来处理。

segments.en: I can't believe he was stalking you all these years.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他这些年一直在跟踪你。

segments.en: What a nut job.
I know.
Well, he said I'm not pregnant.
I'm sorry if I got you all worked up over nothing.
segments.cn: 如果我让你为一些小事紧张，我很抱歉。

segments.en: I want you to know that I didn't do it on purpose.
segments.cn: 我想让你知道我不是故意的。

segments.en: Don't apologize.
From the moment I met you, not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you.
segments.cn: 从我见到你的那一刻起，没有一天过去我没有想过你。

segments.en: And now that I'm with you again, I'm just scared, Veronica.
segments.cn: 现在我又和你在一起，我只是害怕，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: The closer I get to you, the worse it gets.
segments.cn: 我越接近你，情况就越糟。

segments.en: The thought of not being with you, I mean, I just can't handle it.
segments.cn: 不和你在一起的想法，我是说，我真的无法承受。

segments.en: We were made for each other, Veronica.
segments.cn: 我们是天造地设的一对，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: You're my everything, my soulmate.
segments.cn: 你是我的一切，我的灵魂伴侣。

segments.en: What can I do?
Just hold me.
I'll always be here for you, no matter what.
segments.cn: 无论如何我都会在你身边。

segments.en: And together, we can tackle whatever life throws at us.
segments.cn: 我们可以一起应对生活给我们的任何挑战。

segments.en: I believe in us, Steven.
I'm so happy to hear that.
I know we belong together.
segments.cn: 我知道我们注定在一起。

segments.en: I love you so much.
Okay, Erika, so who do you think got shot?
segments.cn: 好的，埃里卡，你认为谁被枪击了？

segments.en: I don't know, but I'm starting to think this story is becoming a soap opera.
segments.cn: 我不知道，但我开始觉得这个故事变成了肥皂剧。

segments.en: Well, it certainly is.
And well, what do you guys think happened?
segments.cn: 那么，你们认为发生了什么？

segments.en: Or who do you think got shot?
segments.cn: 或者你们认为谁被枪击了？

segments.en: Who did the shooting?
Who shot who?
Was it even a gunshot?
Maybe it was just the car.
The tire could have popped.
I don't know.
So well, come to our website, tell us what you think happens or what you would like to happen.
segments.cn: 所以，来我们的网站，告诉我们你认为发生了什么或你希望发生什么。

segments.en: Because I know many people are expecting a little bit more romance, maybe, and less drama.
segments.cn: 因为我知道很多人期待更多的浪漫，也许少一点戏剧。

segments.en: But if you have any questions about the language in this lesson, please visit the website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 但如果你对本课的语言有任何问题，请访问网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Exactly.
Erika and I are always there to answer your questions and well, anything you guys need.
segments.cn: Erika 和我总是在这里回答你们的问题，以及你们需要的任何东西。

segments.en: Anything?
Anything.
Well, thanks for listening to this lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，感谢你收听这节课。

segments.en: And until next time, goodbye.
